Articles.Content:
I recently downloaded the x64 (64 bit) version of KSP 0.24.2 - I was sadly disappointed how slowly it was running on my system (seemed a bi glitchy too)? So I downloaded the 32 bit version and it runs great! Is it my PC? I have a Toshiba I7 laptop running Windows 8. I never really had problems running KSP before and I do a lot of Whackjob stuff like this.

JR

Edited August 25, 2014 by Jolly_Roger
the 64bit version of KSP is buggy at best, and there's not much Squad can do about it because it's Unity that's bugged.

perhaps a be a driver issue?

motherboard chipset or graphics card

have you updated them recently?

Thanks fir the info, I'll stick with the 32 bit version for now - at least until Unity puts out a proper patch.

One other question; are the craft files and saves switchable between the x32 and x64 versions? I haven't tried it yet but I thought I'd ask first, since I got such a quick reply to my first question.

JR
I haven't tried but I'd be surprised if there is any problem with that, just copy the craft files from your old save\SPH & VAB folders to the new one

perhaps a be a driver issue?

motherboard chipset or graphics card

have you updated them recently?

I have 2GB graphics chip set - my laptop is practically brand new <1yr everything should be up to date.

JR

I have 2GB graphics chip set - my laptop is practically brand new <1yr everything should be up to date.

JR

ah ok, you're probably better off with the 32 bit version anyway, I can't tell you how many strange issues I've had with x64, I'm thinking of reverting back to x86 too.

Yeah, sounds like that's the best approach - why mess with a good thing.

JR

I too have had to stop playing in 64bit mode. I was playing fine for the a great while, but now all it does is crash whenever I attempt to load into a building at the space center. 32 bit mode does not share the same corruption issues.
